objectType.name: Resource
objectType.description: The resources (like services, data collections, organizations) present in this registry.

attribute.name: ivoid
attribute.description: Unambiguous reference to the resource conforming to the IVOA standard for identifiers.

attribute.name: res_type
attribute.description: Resource type (something like vg:authority, vs:catalogservice, etc).

attribute.name: created
attribute.description: The UTC date and time this resource metadata description was created.

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.description: A short name or abbreviation given to something, for presentation in space-constrained fields (up to 16 characters).

attribute.name: res_title
attribute.description: The full name given to the resource.

attribute.name: updated
attribute.description: The UTC date this resource metadata description was last updated.

attribute.name: content_level
attribute.description: A hash-separated list of content levels specifying the intended audience.

attribute.name: res_description
attribute.description: An account of the nature of the resource.

attribute.name: reference_url
attribute.description: URL pointing to a human-readable document describing this resource.

attribute.name: creator_seq
attribute.description: The creator(s) of the resource in the order given by the resource record author, separated by semicolons.

attribute.name: content_type
attribute.description: A hash-separated list of natures or genres of the content of the resource.

attribute.name: source_format
attribute.description: The format of source_value. This, in particular, can be ``bibcode''.

attribute.name: source_value
attribute.description: A bibliographic reference from which the present resource is derived or extracted.

attribute.name: res_version
attribute.description: Label associated with creation or availability of a version of a resource.

attribute.name: region_of_regard
attribute.description: A single numeric value representing the angle, given in decimal degrees, by which a positional query against this resource should be ``blurred'' in order to get an appropriate match.

attribute.name: waveband
attribute.description: A hash-separated list of regions of the electro-magnetic spectrum that the resource's spectral coverage overlaps with.

attribute.name: rights
attribute.description: A statement of usage conditions (license, attribution, embargo, etc).

attribute.name: rights_uri
attribute.description: A URI identifying a license the data is made available under.

objectType.name: Role
objectType.description: Entities (persons or organizations) operating on re- sources: creators, contacts, publishers, contributors.

attribute.name: role_name
attribute.description: The ivoa:real-world name or title of a person or organization.

attribute.name: role_ivoid
attribute.description: An IVOA identifier of a person or organization.

attribute.name: street_address
attribute.description: A mailing address for a person or organization.

attribute.name: email
attribute.description: An email address the entity can be reached at.

attribute.name: telephone
attribute.description: A telephone number the entity can be reached at.

attribute.name: logo
attribute.description: URL pointing to a graphical logo, which may be used to help identify the entity.

attribute.name: base_role
attribute.description: The role played by this entity; this is one of contact, publisher, contributor, or creator.

objectType.name: Subject
objectType.description: Topics, object types, or other descriptive keywords about the resource.

attribute.name: res_subject
attribute.description: Topics, object types, or other descriptive keywords about the resource.

objectType.name: Capability
objectType.description: Pieces of behaviour of a resource

attribute.name: cap_index
attribute.description: An arbitrary identifier of this capability within the resource.

attribute.name: cap_type
attribute.description: The type of capability covered here. If looking for endpoints implementing a certain standard, you should not use this column but rather match against standard_id.

attribute.name: cap_description
attribute.description: A human-readable description of what this capability provides as part of the over-all service.

attribute.name: standard_id
attribute.description: A URI for a standard this capability conforms to.

objectType.name: Schema
objectType.description: Sets of tables related to resources

attribute.name: schema_index
attribute.description: An arbitrary identifier for the res_schema rows belonging to a resource.

attribute.name: schema_description
attribute.description: A free text description of the tableset explaining in general how all of the tables are related.

attribute.name: schema_name
attribute.description: A name for the set of tables.

attribute.name: schema_title
attribute.description: A descriptive, human-interpretable name for the table set.

attribute.name: schema_utype
attribute.description: An identifier for a concept in a data model that the data in this schema as a whole represent.

objectType.name: Table
objectType.description: (Relational) tables that are part of schemata or resources.

attribute.name: schema_index
attribute.description: Index of the schema this table belongs to, if it belongs to a schema (otherwise NULL).

attribute.name: table_description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the table's contents.

attribute.name: table_name
attribute.description: The fully qualified name of the table. As per VODataService, this includes all catalog or schema prefixes needed to distinguish it in a query, and it comes with SQL delimiters where necessary.

attribute.name: table_index
attribute.description: An arbitrary identifier for the tables belonging to a resource.

attribute.name: table_title
attribute.description: A descriptive, human-interpretable name for the table.

attribute.name: table_type
attribute.description: A name for the role this table plays. Recognized values include 'output', indicating this table is output from a query; 'base_table', indicating a table whose records represent the main subjects of its schema; and 'view', indicating that the table represents a useful combination or subset of other tables. Other values are allowed.

attribute.name: table_utype
attribute.description: An identifier for a concept in a data model that the data in this table as a whole represent.

attribute.name: table_index
attribute.description: Index of the table this column belongs to.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the column.

attribute.name: ucd
attribute.description: A unified content descriptor that describes the scientific content of the column.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit associated with all values in the column.

attribute.name: utype
attribute.description: An identifier for a role in a data model that the data in this column represents.

attribute.name: std
attribute.description: If 1, the meaning and use of this column is reserved and defined by a standard model. If 0, it represents a database-specific column that effectively extends beyond the standard.

attribute.name: datatype
attribute.description: The type of the data contained in the column.

attribute.name: extended_schema
attribute.description: An identifier for the schema that the value given by the extended attribute is drawn from.

attribute.name: extended_type
attribute.description: A custom type for the values this column contains.

attribute.name: arraysize
attribute.description: The shape of the array that constitutes the value, e.g., 4, *, 4*, 5x4, or 5x*, as specified by VOTable.

attribute.name: delim
attribute.description: The ivoa:string that is used to delimit elements of an array value when arraysize is not '1'.

attribute.name: type_system
attribute.description: The type system used, as a QName with a canonical prefix; this will ususally be one of vs:simpledatatype, vs:votabletype, and vs:taptype.

attribute.name: flag
attribute.description: Hash-separated keywords representing traits of the column. Recognized values include 'indexed', 'primary', and 'nullable'.

attribute.name: column_description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the column's contents.

objectType.name: Interface
objectType.description: Information on access modes of a capability

attribute.name: cap_index
attribute.description: The index of the parent capability.

attribute.name: intf_index
attribute.description: An arbitrary identifier for the interfaces of a resource.

attribute.name: intf_type
attribute.description: The type of the interface (vr:webbrowser, vs:paramhttp, etc).

attribute.name: intf_role
attribute.description: An identifier for the role the interface plays in the particular capability. If the value is equal to 'std' or begins with 'std:', then the interface refers to a standard interface defined by the standard referred to by the capability's standardID attribute.

attribute.name: std_version
attribute.description: The version of a standard interface specification that this interface complies with. When the interface is provided in the context of a Capability element, then the standard being refered to is the one identified by the Capability's standardID element.

attribute.name: query_type
attribute.description: Hash-joined list of expected HTTP method (get or post) supported by the service.

attribute.name: result_type
attribute.description: The MIME type of a document returned in the HTTP response.

attribute.name: wsdl_url
attribute.description: The location of the WSDL that describes this Web Service. If NULL, the location can be assumed to be the accessURL with '?wsdl' appended.

attribute.name: url_use
attribute.description: A flag indicating whether this should be interpreted as a base URL ('base'), a full URL ('full'), or a URL to a directory that will produce a listing of files ('dir').

attribute.name: access_url
attribute.description: The URL at which the interface is found.

attribute.name: mirror_url
attribute.description: Secondary access URLs of this interface, separated by hash characters.

attribute.name: authenticated_only
attribute.description: A flag for whether an interface is available for anonymous use (=0) or only authenticated clients are served (=1).

attribute.name: intf_index
attribute.description: The index of the interface this parameter belongs to.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the parameter.

attribute.name: ucd
attribute.description: A unified content descriptor that describes the scientific content of the parameter.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit associated with all values in the parameter.

attribute.name: utype
attribute.description: An identifier for a role in a data model that the data in this parameter represents.

attribute.name: std
attribute.description: If 1, the meaning and use of this parameter is reserved and defined by a standard model. If 0, it represents a database-specific parameter that effectively extends beyond the standard.

attribute.name: datatype
attribute.description: The type of the data contained in the parameter.

attribute.name: extended_schema
attribute.description: An identifier for the schema that the value given by the extended attribute is drawn from.

attribute.name: extended_type
attribute.description: A custom type for the values this parameter contains.

attribute.name: arraysize
attribute.description: The shape of the array that constitutes the value, e.g., 4, *, 4*, 5x4, or 5x*, as specified by VOTable.

attribute.name: delim
attribute.description: The ivoa:string that is used to delimit elements of an array value when arraysize is not '1'.

attribute.name: param_use
attribute.description: An indication of whether this parameter is required to be provided for the application or service to work properly (one of required, optional, ignored, or NULL).

attribute.name: param_description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the parameter's contents.

objectType.name: Relationship
objectType.description: Relationships between resources (like mirroring, derivation, serving a data collection)

attribute.name: relationship_type
attribute.description: The type of the relationship; these terms are drawn from a controlled vocabulary and are DataCite-compatible.

attribute.name: related_id
attribute.description: The IVOA identifier for the resource referred to.

attribute.name: related_name
attribute.description: The name of resource that this resource is related to.

objectType.name: Validation
objectType.description: Validation levels for resources and capabilities

attribute.name: validated_by
attribute.description: The IVOA ID of the registry or organisation that assigned the validation level.

attribute.name: val_level
attribute.description: A numeric grade describing the quality of the resource description, when applicable, to be used to indicate the confidence an end-user can put in the resource as part of a VO application or research study.

attribute.name: cap_index
attribute.description: If non-NULL, the validation only refers to the capability referenced here.

objectType.name: ResDate
objectType.description: A date associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource

attribute.name: date_value
attribute.description: A date associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource.

attribute.name: value_role
attribute.description: A ivoa:string indicating what the date refers to, e.g., created, availability, updated. This value is generally drawn from a controlled vocabulary.

objectType.name: Detail
objectType.description: XPath-value pairs for members of resource or capability and their derivations that are less used and/or from VOResource extensions

attribute.name: cap_index
attribute.description: The index of the parent capability; if NULL the xpath-value pair describes a member of the entire resource.

attribute.name: detail_xpath
attribute.description: The xpath of the data item.

attribute.name: detail_value
attribute.description: (Atomic) value of the member.

objectType.name: AltIdentifier
objectType.description: An alternate identifier associated with this record

attribute.name: alt_identifier
attribute.description: An identifier for the resource or an entity related to the resource in URI form.

attribute.name: coverage
attribute.description: A geometry representing the area a resource contains data for; this should be tight at least with a resolution of degrees.

attribute.name: ref_system_name
attribute.description: The reference frame coverage is written in. This is currently reserved and fixed to NULL. Clients should always add a constraint to NULL for this to avoid matching non-celestial resources later.

objectType.name: STCTemporal
objectType.description: The temporal coverage of resources, given as one or more intervals.

attribute.name: time_start
attribute.description: Lower limit of a time interval covered by the resource in MJD.

attribute.name: time_end
attribute.description: Upper limit of a time interval covered by the resource in MJD.

objectType.name: STCSpectral
objectType.description: The spectral coverage of resources, given as one or more intervals.

attribute.name: spectral_start
attribute.description: Lower limit (in Joules) of messenger energy interval covered by the resource (for the solar system barycenter).

attribute.name: spectral_end
attribute.description: Upper limit (in Joules) of messenger energy interval covered by the resource (for the solar system barycenter).

attribute.name: svcid
attribute.description: IVOA identifier of the TAP service making this table queriable.

attribute.name: table_name
attribute.description: The fully qualified name of the table. As per VODataService, this includes all catalog or schema prefixes needed to distinguish it in a query, and it comes with SQL delimiters where necessary.

attribute.name: table_title
attribute.description: A descriptive, human-interpretable name for the table.

attribute.name: table_description
attribute.description: A free-text description of the table's contents.

attribute.name: table_utype
attribute.description: An identifier for a concept in a data model that the data in this table as a whole represent.
